quest.name: Promises to Keep
journal: Raubahn would like to discuss how to handle the Doman refugees.
Regardless of the Syndicate's decision, Raubahn is not content to ignore the Domans' plight. He bids you and the others accompany him to the Hall of Flames to discuss what options remain available.

Concluding that the other city–states are unlike to accept the refugees, Alphinaud proffers an alternative solution. Rather than petitioning another nation for aid, the Domans might instead travel to the outpost of Revenant's Toll, where they could work as frontier hands in exchange for food and shelter. Though Yugiri is amenable to the idea, the matter of how the refugees would make a journey of so great a distance remains. Believing that the Ul'dahn Adventurers' Guild may be of assistance, Alphinaud departs for the Quicksand and invites you to follow.

Momodi has agreed to provide temporary accommodations for the Domans, so that they might regain their strength before embarking on their journey. Alphinaud bids you rest your own legs for a moment, then return to Vesper Bay to meet your guests and escort them to the place they will sojourn.
objectives: Speak with Raubahn at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As Lord Lolorito goes, so goes the Syndicate...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: My people could not endure another long sea voyage. But if Ul'dah will not accept us, what choice have we?

dialogue.name: KASASAGI
dialogue.text: “Prone to violence and criminal activity”!? Who is he to speak of us thus? Are we to be punished for sins we may never commit?

dialogue.name: KIKYOU
dialogue.text: Did they not hear Lady Yugiri's pleas? How can they turn us away, knowing what we have endured?

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: It bears repeating that Lord Lolorito does not speak for the Syndicate.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: The others harbor doubts, I will allow, but in time they shall see the error of their ways.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As you observed, Lolorito is not afraid to speak his mind─nor is he like to change it.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Oft have I wondered how a man so skilled at weighing the worth of things should be so incapable of seeing the value in people...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Bah. I will waste no more words on him─not when the Domans are yet in need of aid. Everyone, follow me to the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm... Mayhap I should have considered the likelihood of failure more deeply beforehand.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: A galleon is no place for my people─for any people─to call home. This cannot continue.

dialogue.name: KASASAGI
dialogue.text: Is there naught we can do to earn the approval of these Ul'dahns?

dialogue.name: KIKYOU
dialogue.text: We do not wish to live by the grace of others. We want to work; we want to contribute!

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: I will not deny that certain portions of the refugee population have been a burden on the sultanate─but I take issue with my counterparts' contention that they account for the majority. In this they are plainly mistaken. Even so, we must not think ill of them for wishing to protect our great nation.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The Syndicate has spoken, and I see no point in moving that the matter be reconsidered. The Monetarists have made their position clear.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Agreed. Ul'dah is not an option.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nor are Limsa Lominsa or Gridania, I judge, given the state of their internal affairs.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Which leaves our Doman friends confined to a ship. Gods, the thought of them huddled in an airless hold with no hope of better treatment...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would that I had more time to find an alternative! A place not bound by the concerns of the great nations─

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Minfilia. ...That is precisely what I wished to discuss.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: I understand the Syndicate's decision, I do. We all wish to preserve that which is ours, especially when we believe it to be under siege.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: But I cannot meekly accept this judgment─not while my people suffer. Would it be out of the question for the sultanate to accept us for a limited time? A week, mayhap, or even just a few days...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Excellent. I shall keep you informed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lady Yugiri, I have a proposal, if you would hear it.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Out with it, Master Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The headquarters of my order, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, stands in a place called Revenant's Toll, an outpost in Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Like most outposts, it is frequented by mercenaries and other men of action, and lacks the comforts of more well-established settlements. However, the leaders of Revenant's Toll have been doing their utmost to change that.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To that end, they have need of able-bodied individuals willing to work as frontier hands. Hard labor, lest you doubt, with naught save food and shelter by way of reward.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Terms not unlike those which you yourself proposed, Lady Yugiri.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: Though I will not hear a word said against our beloved Ul'dah, Revenant's Toll would offer certain advantages─the absence of unhelpful bureaucracy being the most obvious.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: If they can accommodate us all, we shall gladly accept!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Master Alphinaud, once again I find myself in your debt.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Pray do not thank me, my lady. The life your people go to is one of hard labor and few comforts, as I told you. And before that, there remains the matter of how they may safely be borne to Revenant's Toll─which will be no small feat, considering the distance and their present condition.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Mayhap the Ul'dahn Adventurers' Guild can be of assistance. Look for me there anon, Forename.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Lady Yugiri, if you and your people would accompany me, we may discuss what aid the Immortal Flames can provide.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are concerned that the Doman refugees may find the journey to Revenant's Toll too much to bear.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Too long have they been sequestered aboard their ship, with insufficient supplies and scarce room enough to breathe, let alone stretch their limbs. With that in mind, Mistress Momodi has kindly offered to accommodate the Domans until such time as they are ready to set out for Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Those healthy enough to travel will embark as soon as transportation has been secured, while those too weak to leave at once will be permitted to stay until they regain their strength.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: What news?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Transportation remains our greatest obstacle, General. Is there aught the Immortal Flames can do?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I fear that exceeds our mandate.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Were it a smaller number, mayhap it would go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the Syndicate will not bear the cost of escorting more than two hundred Domans to Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: When government fails to act, the responsibility falls to us private citizens.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: I will engage the services of the Seventy-Seven Caravans on the Domans' behalf.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Very well─we should begin contract negotiations at once. Your generosity is most welcome, my lord.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: After all that has befallen these good people, it is the least I can do.

dialogue.name: TELEDJIADELEDJI
dialogue.text: Come what may, you shall ever have a friend in Ul'dah, Lady Yugiri.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: And you in Revenant's Toll, my lord.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Well, it sounds like we all have work to do! Lady Yugiri, let's put our heads together an' settle the details of our arrangement, shall we?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I would entrust the task of escorting our Doman friends to you─after you have rested your own road-weary legs, of course. What say you?
